name: Spicy Mala Beef Stir-Fry
description: This spicy, savory, and satisfying dish combines the best of Japanese and Chinese cuisine and is ready in no time!

ingredients.ingredient: 2 tablespoons chili oil from mala paste

instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of chili oil from mala paste in a large pan or wok over medium heat. Add 3 cloves of chopped garlic and 1 large sliced onion, and stir-fry until the onion is tender.
Add 500 grams of thinly sliced beef to the pan. Cook until the beef is tender and juicy, stirring frequently.

Mix in 2 tablespoons of mala paste, 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, 2 tablespoons of teriyaki sauce, and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil. Stir well to combine all the flavors and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce has thickened and coated the beef and vegetables evenly.
Pile the spicy beef and veggies over a bowl of steaming rice.
